english: to send; to deliver; to see off; to give (as a gift)

etymology.description: semantic: 辶 (“to walk”) + phonetic: 灷 (zhuàn)
etymology.interpretation: Movement indicated by 辶 suggests going, sending, or accompanying, aligning with meanings like to deliver or see off. 灷 supplies the sound value, approximating the historical pronunciation (OC *sloːŋs) that developed into modern sòng.

examples.chinese: 我送你回家(我送你回家)。
快递员把包裹送到公司(快遞員把包裹送到公司)。
examples.pinyin: Kuàidìyuán bǎ bāoguǒ sòng dào gōngsī.
examples.english: The courier delivered the package to the company.

examples.chinese: 生日时(生日時)，她送了我一本书(她送了我一本書)。
examples.pinyin: Shēngrì shí, tā sòng le wǒ yì běn shū.
examples.english: She gave me a book for my birthday.
